227.comments: VISA 210 227 will be delivered 100% online, with some synchronous (i.e., "real time") and some asynchronous components. Twelve seats in this section are reserved for students in the Bachelor of Media Studies (BMS) program. The other eight seats are open to any UBC student with the prerequisites.

228.comments: VISA 210 228 will be delivered 100% online, with some synchronous (i.e., "real time") and some asynchronous components. This section of VISA 210 is reserved for students in the Bachelor of Media Studies (BMS) program.

001.comments: VISA 210 001 will be delivered 100% online, with some synchronous (i.e., "real time") and some asynchronous components. If registration for this class is blocked, then it is full and you should register on the corresponding waitlist. Students will be periodically moved from the waitlist into the class as seats become available, and notified of their registration via email.

01W.comments: VISA 210 01W is a waiting list for VISA 210 001. Students will be moved from the waiting list into the course, space permitting, in order of registration date.

02W.comments: VISA 210 02W is a waitlist for VISA 210 002. Students will be moved from the waiting list into the course, space permitting, in order of registration date.

03W.comments: VISA 210 03W is a waiting list for VISA 210 003. Students will be moved from the waiting list into the course, space permitting, in order of registration date.While we hope all interested students will obtain a seat in this class, please be aware that being in the waiting list does not guarantee you will obtain a seat in the class.

description: Examination of current art practices and issues related to digital technologies and contemporary culture, with an emphasis on the theoretical conceptualization of digital artistic media.
